original_title: Modern Spark Gap Transmitter Uses a Rotary Gap
original_content:
In the dont try this at home category, [Joe Smith] builds a spark gap transmitter with a twist. The twist is that the drive power is from a signal generator attached to a FET. From there, though, things go classic using an automotive ignition coil and a tank circuit. He shows how adjusting the spark frequency changes the signals sound in a standard receiver.
We say dont try this at home because the output of a transmitter like this will likely spew RF all over the place. Granted, theres probably not much power, but it may well irritate your neighbors.
Switching to AM, you can really hear the tone from the spark frequency in the receiver. [Joe] posted some earlier videos where he made a 160-meter spark gap transmitter using an electric fly swatter. There are more details about how the tank circuits work in those videos. You can also see what the output looks like on a spectrum analyzer. You can hear what that transmitter sounds like, too.
title: 「不安定ながら面白い！FETを使用したスパークギャップトランスミッターの作成方法」
body: 自宅では試してはいけないですが、[Joe Smith]はスパークギャップトランスミッターを作ります。信号発生器とFETを使って駆動し、自動車の点火コイルとタンク回路を使用します。スパーク周波数を調整すると、受信機で信号の音が変わります。 RFが拡散されるため、近隣住民を迷惑させないよう注意が必要です。
